fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1-) Rename a .pdf file (ex: book.pdf) into a .gif file (ex:. book.gif)
2-) Try to insert the .gif file in a Confluence page as an image (using "Insert Image" pop-up window)
3-) An "Page Not Found" error page is shown (see attached screenshot)

It should show an "Invalid File" message or something similar.
fields.summary: Inserting "false image" shows "Page Not Found Error"

fields.description:
CSP-19738 is reference. Outlook 2007 is unable to retrieve RSS feeds via SSL. Displays a server not found type of error.

I recognize that this appears to be a client side issue but I'm opening this as a request anyway because:
* Enterprises tend to use Office and are slowly upgrading to Office 2007. Outlook 2007, with its RSS support, will quickly become the defacto RSS reader for these companies.
* Microsoft and Atlassian have partnered to present the SharePoint / Confluence connection. SharePoint 2007 is full of RSS capabilities and Outlook 2007 will be Microsoft's recommended default reader. Atlassian should leverage the partnership to resolve the SSL RSS issue.
* As companies become more security minded we're seeing that they're SSL protecting more and more of their web enabled applications. Confluence is on that list so I would expect to see more and more SSL related issues arise.

----

Update: I just finished doing some Googling and, according to a statement made by Sean Lyndersay, the PM of the RSS Team back in Sep of 06, Outlook 2007 DOES support SSL-encrypted feeds. ([reference|http://www.hanselman.com/blog/IE7RC1CantUpdatePasswordProtectedFeeds.aspx]). This suggests that the issue is indeed on the Confluence side after all.
fields.summary: Outlook 2007 is unable to read Confluence RSS feeds over HTTPS

fields.description:
Email notifications for pages with dynamic tasklists display the tasklist in an almost completely unstyled way that takes up lots of space and are hard to read.

Email notifications that contain dynamic tasklists do not include a request for the tasklist.css stylesheet.  
On a web page the DTL requires {noformat}<script src="/s/1403/20/3.0.4/_/download/resources/confluence.extra.dynamictasklist2:web-resources/tasklist.js" type="text/javascript">{noformat} in the head.
Emails containing tasklists do not request this resource.  I would guess this is Confluence's fault and not the tasklist's.
fields.summary: Tasklists are not rendered nicely in HTML email notifications

fields.description:
Importing a space with special characters such as "-", in its space key, will render the space inaccessible.

Steps to reproduce:

1) Referring to [these|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Copy+Or+Rename+A+Space] guidelines, change the space key in a space export, to a name with "-" in it. 
2) Restore the space.
3) The space is reported to have been restored successfully with the space being listed on the Dashboard.
4) Click on the "Browse Space" icon and notice the URL change to:
{noformat}
http://<Hostname>/pages/listpages.action?key=$generalUtil.urlEncode($helper.spaceKey)
{noformat}
and no content being displayed.
5) Try deleting this space by going to the delete space URL directly:
{noformat}
http://<Hostname>/spaces/removespace.action?key=<Space key>
{noformat}
will give an error:
{quote}
 The following error(s) occurred:
    * Space keys may only consist of ASCII letters or numbers (A-Z, a-z, 0-9)
    * The space specified does not exist.
{quote}
6) Click on the "OK" button on the dialog for confirmation for deleting the space, no action is initiated. *The space cannot be deleted via the UI*.
7) All other actions (except View Attachments), when accessed via the URL directly, give a "Page Not Found" error.
fields.summary: Restoring a space with special caracters in the space key, makes it inaccessible

fields.description:
I think 1024x768 could still be considered a common screen size, especially for laptops.

Your documentation frequently includes screenshots and snippets of preformatted text that push the page beyond my screen width.

This itself is bad (you should have overflow: auto on pre blocks and trim or thumbnail your screenshots), but it particularly heinous when the text I am trying to read expands so far that it does not fit inside 1024 pixels and I am forced to scroll horizontally to read *each line*.
fields.summary: Limit page width (images and pre text)

fields.description:
In 2.8 the Print Preview Button vanished.

So i created up a support ticket [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-19658] to request where its gone. It is no longer supported, ok. So the Printpreview of the browser has to be used, so far its just a *Inform all Users of the change* behaviour, but i have also a issue on how that effects the layout.

I attached a screenshot of the official bamboo Space how its renders, with the text {{tools}} in the upper right and with the creator/editor of the page... thats not really cute, and of course not the behaviour it was in older releases, was it?.

^Another example of our current dashboard, the 2.8 release is unprintable, the spacelist disappears completely from the preview. On the 2.5 it was a good preview, but that can be a self driven problem, as it has changed a bit with div/tables.^

I got the suggestion to use the classic theme or ask the forums... 
I just tried that, but still there is the creator/editor line, just to be mentioned. We will evaluate the classic theme more, but i was just finished modifying the latest theme and now i am stuck between modifying this or the classic :(
fields.summary: Default PrintPreview not as expected / not available / not as before

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12077].
  {panel}

Confluence should support stadard wiki syntax. 

Currently there are several projects aiming to standardize the wiki syntax.

* Creole - http://www.wikicreole.org/wiki/Engines
* Meatball - http://www.usemod.com/cgi-bin/mb.pl?WikiSyntax
fields.summary: Support for standardized wiki syntax like Creole

fields.description:
When I type "C++" (C-plus-plus in case it crashed here too) on the WYSIWYG editor it gets converted (and screwed up) to underlined.

I have to go to the Wiki syntax editor, quote the signals and save. It works, but later on, when I click on edit it again it goes first to the WYSIWYG editor and screw it up again before I can even use the Wiki syntax editor.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Writing the plus signal on WYSIWYG editor
CSS style does not use different color for visited links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12073].
  {panel}

There should be a glossary page with a list of terms and descriptions for them, The rendered should mark all terms found in pages and add the description as a tooltip for them.

MediaWiki have such a useful extension at http://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Extension:Glossary

The glossary itself it's just another wiki page.

This feature is very useful because it does auto document special terms like acronyms.
fields.summary: Glossary feature that would mark glossary entries and display the glossary entry as a tooltip in all pages

fields.description:
Search does not work for PDF files containing Japanese text. Please try with the [test file attached|^グリーンシップ募集要項.pdf]. Search was tested after rebuilding the Confluence index. 

Seems like a problem with the extractor being used in Confluence 2.6.0, 2.7.1.

_Update:_ If you rename the Japanese PDF to roman characters, you can find the file name itself in search results, but the file contents look corrupted as in the [screenshot|^PDF_Search.png]. This is expected since the extractor is unable to parse the Japanese PDF and so the contents of the Lucene index also contain corrupted characters.
fields.summary: Search not working for PDF files containing Japanese text

fields.description:
*Initial situation:*

    * space A with label 'labelA' and 'de' (both labels are space labels and visible in space administration)
    * space B with label 'labelB' and 'de' (both labels are space labels and visible in space administration)
    * several pages in space B are labeled with 'de' and 'labelB'
      *Now export / import:*
    * export of space B
    * deletion of space B
    * import backup file of space B
      *Error situation*
    * after import of space B: the space labels are still visible in space administration (which is correct)
    * after import of space B: pages, which were labeled with 'labelB' and 'de', are now only labeled with 'labelB' (label 'de' disappeared)
    * the assignment of the label 'de' in the imported space B got lost on all pages, which had the assignment before

There is no effect on the other space A, which is correct. But the label 'de', which was used also in space A, isnt longer assigned to pages in space B.
fields.summary: Label missing after restoration

fields.description:
We have confluence 2.5.6 running and it allows case sensitive Adding, Editing, Viewing of Groups, either via SOAP and Web-UI.

Now i am running my SOAP-Management on a 2.8.1 and saw that it only allows lowercase anymore, but still the items in the database are case-sensitive. Of course you can recommend now, that i lowercase my existing groups, but that isnt the point.

I can remember when i got an officially statement that case sensitive should be there because of integration with other user frameworks. So i wonder why it has been changed to lower completely. Hope you can fix this in the 2.8.* releases.

I am not really sure that will be done, please give me a good reason why case sensitivity has been turned off, as i am willing to switch to a 2.8+ release in the next future, but this gives me a big headache... (things on upgrading you not think of :( )
fields.summary: SOAP method addGroup gives error when creating uppercase group names in 2.8, but didn't in 2.5.6

fields.description:
This is actually a "Good Thing", since it will uncover an old bug in Confluence. This being a runtime dependency on Webwork1 .... nice.

Atlassian Core 3.11 has removed all webwork1 dependencies, this helps out in a few areas, including the weird POM errors with Maven that you may of been getting in IDEA. e.g. WTF is webwork1 doing on my classpath!

I have assigned this the MattJ since he is working with some of the Velocity stuff at the moment and this will actually be the area where the error will occur, yep there is webwork1 dependent class in your velocity context... nice :)
fields.summary: Upgrade Confluence to use Atlassian Core 3.11

fields.description: From Java 1.4 the xml apis are included, hence Confluence should not need to bundle it anymore.
fields.summary: Remove xmlapis dependency from Confluence

fields.description:
The HSQL warning message has a link to the FAQ but its not a hyper link.
We can embed HTML here so it should be a proper hyperlink
fields.summary: HSQL warning should include proper hyperlink to the FAQ

fields.description:
There is no documentation on how to migrate a user repo from osuser(+LDAP) to atlassian-user(+LDAP). We are running into a lot of support cases because this process is not documented properly.
We need an idiot proof step by step guide a la http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF256/Add+LDAP+Integration that is updated for 28. Customers are still using osuser and need to migrate user management to hibernate.
The only version where this process works is 281, see http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-12009. Users need to be aware of that. 

Let me know if there's any clarification you need.
fields.summary: Need Documentation for Migration osuser > atlassian user with existing LDAP

fields.description:
From Blitz, AK, reproducible:

"alphabetize' the ordered page and then drop several pages on top of it. The 'rollback' icon does not disappear when you drop new pages. What does it actually do when you click 'rollback' what is the order?"

When another page is dropped under the parent, say in between two other pages, while the revert is showing - the revert is removed as expected. The bug occurs when dropping the page over the parent - the tree must consider itself still alphabetically ordered and hence able to be reverted, but revert requires the node children to be unchanged apart from order.
fields.summary: Page Tree - revert icon inconsistent when dropping pages over parent
Label autocomplete should be like the Confluence Questions labels component

fields.description:
The current Memory information for the system information page can be confusing to users. As it basically reports to you the current memory usage levels, this can be misleading and result in users to believing the JVM parameters parsed to the JVM do not take effect or have not been configured correctly when in fact they have.

For example, when setting the boundaries for the memory with varying -Xms and -Xmx settings, Confluence initially shows memory usage up to the minimum memory setting. As the usage increases, it will eventually be updated in the system info page to reflect the current usage levels.

Example, this is the current Heap size settings for my 2.8.0 instance:

{noformat}
# Initial Java Heap Size (in MB) 
wrapper.java.initmemory=512m 
 
# Maximum Java Heap Size (in MB) 
wrapper.java.maxmemory=756m 
{noformat}

The screenshot shows the current total at *508 MB*. Some users with this configuration would expect to see total memory as *756 MB* instead. Perhaps we can include a script that can be run to retrieve memory information on demand? I've attached an example jsp i wrote which grabs information on the current JVM properties:

{noformat}
# Java version:  1.5.0_13
# Java Home: /System/Library/Frameworks/JavaVM.framework/Versions/1.5.0/Home
# Java classpath: ../wrapper/lib/wrapper.jar:/Library/Java/Home/lib/tools.jar:../bin/bootstrap.jar
# Total Memory: 532873216
# Max Memory: 786628608
# Free Memory: 386200112
{noformat}
 
Something like this could be useful for checking and validating *actual* memory settings rather than the current usage.
fields.summary: Enhance Memory information on System Information Page

fields.description:
Upgrading from Confluence 2.7.1 to Confluence 2.8.1 we found that the output of the macro popular-labels is always ordered by popularity, both if the parameter style=heatmap is specified or not.
With this syntax: {popular-labels:style=heatmap|count=100} (according to the documentation) the output should be ordered alphabetically with the font depending on popularity.
fields.summary: popular-labels macro doesn't order the labels alphabetically
{include} macro and page without permission to view included page

fields.description: Hot referrer links on our confluence site seems to have incorrect links. The links are formed as follows for some reason: {code:html} confluence/dashboard.action {code} For some reason href content is URL encoded.
fields.summary: Hot Referrers section in page info has broken links

fields.description:
Happens when re-ordering more than one node at once, via space tree:

1. Set top level (e.g. Home page) and lower level to non-alpha by manual ordering. 
2. Go away. 
3. Come back and set top level and lower level to alpha by clicking the "A". 
4. Now click the undo arrow to revert the top level to non-alpha. (Leave the lower level as alpha i.e. do not click the arrow.) 
5. Go away. 
6. Come back — the top level is alpha. It should not be. - SM"

Verified in IE7, no JS errors displayed.
fields.summary: Page Tree loses manual order after operations

fields.description: Verified - works for FF but broken in IE.
fields.summary: Page Tree in IE6 - pressing ESC doesn't abort Drag-n-Drop

fields.description: In IE6, the top of the icon is chopped by 1 pixel, in FF the bottom of the icon is chopped. Must be the height of the li based on Classic theme text size.
fields.summary: Page Tree node icons chopped in Classic theme
Make Page Tree alphabetize icon consistent

fields.description: The init script for the quicksearch box in master.js does not check to see if the quicksearch box is present. This can cause Javascript errors in themes that have removed the search box.
fields.summary: Javascript init script for the quicksearch box dies badly if quicksearch not present in theme

fields.description:
AJS.toInit() allows you to register functions to be run on page init. However, if you register multiple functions and one function fails, the failure is not logged anywhere and subsequent functions are not run.

This can lead to some hard-to-track-down errors, such as drop-down menus not working.
fields.summary: AJS toInit() failures are not logged, can cause subsequent init functions not to run

fields.description:
It is possible to drag nodes from the tree to the left of their position, in the left-nav theme. This only seems to occur when dragging expanded parent nodes, and is difficult to replicate. No JavaScript errors are raised.

Also, from AL - "Occasionally messes up the drop target and leaves a hideous mess"
fields.summary: Page Tree drags leave node copies inside, outside of tree
Page tree layout - help text right aligned

fields.description:
From [blitz|http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/QA/Issues+Raised+30-05-08] item 9:

" No labels suggested 	 AP 	 FF2 	 DEFAULT 	 pic 	 
 Clickr does not have autosuggest.... neither when you type, nor the suggested labels. maybe that is the default behavious anyway? 	PF 	  	CLIKR 	  	 
 Can't make autocomplete to appear at all. 	DB 	Safari 	  	  	 
 Just start typing" doesn't work. No suggestions made PC Opera"
fields.summary: Label autocomplete never appears

fields.description:
Edit this page: http://qa-eac.atlassian.com/confluence/pages/editpage.action?pageId=662110626 and try to edit Location, will get a JS error:

node has no properties
http://qa-eac.atlassian.com/confluence/s/1403/29/1.0/_/download/resources/confluence.web.resources:page-ordering-tree/tree.js
Line 91

This is because the back-end has not populated expandedNodes correctly for the page tree, you can also see this in the location path:

Location:   Confluence Development    > Home   Done 

It should be  Confluence Development > Confluence Induction > Home > Analysis of bundling new tasklist
fields.summary: Javascript error when editing location for pages that are deep descendants and have been moved
Improve initial Tomcat console message for starting Confluence

fields.description: definitely a problem already in 2.8, possibly earlier.
fields.summary: Long labels break breadcrumbs in header

fields.description:
With long labels, or long lists of labels, and narrow window width, this can be easily replicated.

Looks like problem is position: relative in CSS selector :

{{#labels-section .confluence-label}}

Which might be needed for IE but not for FF, etc.
fields.summary: Labels appear in front of page menus

fields.description: Also occurs when adding labels in classic.
fields.summary: Resize of the gray box during label-removal in the classic theme
Display labels when Viewing content in Clickr theme

fields.description: WYSIWYG editing does not work with a table enclosed in the \{table-plus\} macro. Instead, the wiki markup is displayed. Removing the table-plus tags makes the table editable. This was not a problem in Confluence 2.4. The table-plus macro should be ignored by the editor.
fields.summary: {table-plus} disables WYSIWYG table editing

fields.description:
When viewing page permissions only the Users ID is displayed.  This is not consistent with many other spots in Confluence where the user's display name is used instead.  This issue appears to have been generally addressed in CONF-298, but not for displaying page permissions.

Within our organization (15,000 employees) every one has  a numeric User ID.  Displaying only the User ID makes it very difficult to understand who has what access to a page.  This issue is preventing a full roll out of Confluence within our organization.
fields.summary: Page permissions displays the User ID not the user's Display Name
Use onbeforeunload to warn when leaving an edit content page

fields.description:
- gallery macro works, only sorting seems to be not really completed as choosing sorting by name is applied on the overview page only but clicking a thumbnail for displaying the big image seems to link the image which would be linked without using the sort option.

- when using no sort option the linked images are always correct
fields.summary: Gallery sorting out of sync between overview and single image page

fields.description:
Trying to export a page contains an image, where the image's name contains umlaute character, breaks Confluence. The steps to reproduce:
# Create an image file or rename the existing image file with the text aerisä.gif. (I have tried to reproduce using image typed: gif, png, jpg).
# Upload the image to a page.
# Put the image to the page using the following wiki markup:
{noformat}
!aerisä.gif!
{noformat}
# Export the page to PDF.
fields.summary: Exporting to PDF with inlined image which name contains umlaute, breaks Confluence

fields.description:
Hi,

We are facing issue while exporting any confluence space to the XML format.
Step to reproduce:
1. Browse the space whose backup has to be taken.
2. Go to 'Advance' tab.
3. Click the "Export Space"
4. Chose 'XML Output' and Export the space.
After some time it will gives an error (attaching screen-shot for the error message).

Error message :
Exception initializing proxy:  com.atlassian.confluence.spaces#

I have checked Log file, their is noting in it.

Regards,
fields.summary: Export confluence space to XML gives error

fields.description:
I've set Custom HTML - 'At end of the BODY'
As far as I see it's included twicely in generated page.
I've found it's defined ($!settingsManager.globalSettings.customHtmlSettings.beforeBodyEnd) in
- main.vmd
- footer.vm
fields.summary: Custom HTML at end of BODY is included twicely

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12028].
  {panel}

The labels editor uses different html for View and Edit pages, and this flows on to differences in validation and JS behaviour. Needs consolidating, and validation should have as much pushed to front-end as possible.

From [Blitz test|http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/QA/Issues+Raised+30-05-08]:

 No add and done buttons either for labels on the edit page, is it supposed to be like that? 	 
  	The labels UI boxes are different on the "view" and "edit" pages. See the attached images. The edit page is just a long line of text instead of the neat labels and 'X' buttons. You'll also notice that the actual suggested labels are different. It may be worth ordering these aphabetically.  
  	The labels panel on the Edit page doesn't have the Add, Done buttons. And still has suggestions on the side, not below the field.

Should have client-side JS validation for label format and be consistent between Edit, Add, View pages.
fields.summary: Make labels editor the same on Edit and View pages
On the "edit attachment" page, can the default radio selection for "update links?" be changed to "yes" instead of "no"?

fields.description:
For an complete discussion please see the issue:

http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/CSOAP-27

From this issue:

Hello,

I have problems with getting zip-archive containig a space export in HTML-Format.

After starting the following command

java -jar release/confluence-cli-1.3.0.jar --server http://ourconfluence/ \
--user mirroruser --password *** --action exportSpace \
--space SPACENAME --file SPACENAME.zip --exportType HTML

the following message appears:

org.swift.common.cli.CliClient$ClientException: java.io.FileNotFoundException:
http://ourconfluence//download/temp/export_05282008_140300/
SPACENAME-20080528-14_05_16.zip?os_username=mirroruser&os_password=***

The zip-file exist in /var/confluence/temp, but not in /var/confluence/download/temp, in the filesystem of our confluence host.

How can I change the temp-directory which cli expected?

Regards
Rolf
fields.summary: Remote API doesn't send the correct download path for exportSpace when baseUrl contains trailing slash

fields.description:
We've created new users for a new project, assigned them user name, etc, but didn't change anything else. 
Then we tried to login with one of the user account. The login succeeded, but it looped until we changed in "Preferences" the default space to a defined project space
fields.summary: New users with default configuration cause loop after login

fields.description:

fields.description:
Since 2.8, the draft AJAX submission allows the insertion of null page IDs in the draft table. This means the following exception message is shown to some users when visiting their drafts:

org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'isMergeRequired' in class $Proxy23 threw exception java.lang.RuntimeException: draft has invalid pageId: 'null' @ /users/viewmydrafts.vm[33,48]
at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.execute(ASTMethod.java:286)
caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: draft has invalid pageId: 'null'
at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultDraftManager.getAbstractPage(DefaultDraftManager.java:217)
caused by: java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "null"
at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException.java:48)

You can see the cause of this problem in the database with the following query:

{{select count\(*) from content where contenttype = 'DRAFT' and draftpageid is null;}}

I'm not yet sure whether the cause of this problem is a front-end bug or not, but this data should certainly be better-validated on the backend before persisting it.
fields.summary: Error page when visiting drafts

fields.description:
Customer gets a linkage error when they try to load a PDF with a PNG.

The java spec relating to these issues is here:

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/jvms/second_edition/html/ConstantPool.doc.html

The customer is seeing this error due to a loading constraint. Here is the explanation of class loading constraints:

A loading constraint is violated if, and only if, all the following four
conditions hold:


There exists a loader L such that L has been recorded by the Java
virtual machine as an initiating loader of a class C named N.

There exists a loader L' such that L' has been recorded by the Java
virtual machine as an initiating loader of a class C' named N.

The equivalence relation defined by the (transitive closure of the) set
of imposed constraints implies N L = N L'.

C != C '. 
***

I 'think' that the idea is that if you have two different class loaders
(L and L'), and each loads a class (L loads C and L' loads C') with the
same name (N), loading constraints will be violated if  C and C' are not
the same class. 

So to bring this back around in relation to issue  	 CSP-19301:

The customer unpacked these jars that ship with confluence:
saxon-6.5.3-patched.jar
ss_css2-0.9.3.jar
xml-apis-1.0.b2.jar
xmlParserAPIs-2.2.1.jar

There are incompatible versions of NodeClass included.

you'll see that they differ in size (1630 vs 1597), indicating that they are different versions of the same class.

rw-rr- 1 ubuntu ubuntu 1630 2000-10-09 18:02 ./saxon-6.5.3-patched.jar/org/w3c/dom/Node.class
rw-rr- 1 ubuntu ubuntu 1630 2003-01-19 23:14 ./ss_css2-0.9.3.jar/org/w3c/dom/Node.class
rw-rr- 1 ubuntu ubuntu 1597 2002-12-01 11:57 ./xml-apis-1.0.b2.jar/org/w3c/dom/Node.class
rw-rr- 1 ubuntu ubuntu 1597 2002-11-11 18:24 ./xmlParserAPIs-2.2.1.jar/org/w3c/dom/Node.class

The following error is thrown

com.atlassian.core.exception.InfrastructureException: java.lang.LinkageError: Class org/w3c/dom/Node violates loader constraints

So this leads back to the point:

if you have two different class loaders
(L and L'), and each loads a class (L loads C and L' loads C') with the
same name (N), loading constraints will be violated if  C and C' are not
the same class.
fields.summary: When customer tries to load a PDF with a PNG file they get a linkage error

fields.description:
When using the multiple label filter, Confluence generates urls for applying additional labels to the filter. These urls are generated by adding the new label to the end of the current url. This make is possible to create multiple urls that result in the same filter being applied.

For example:

http://wikis.sun.com/label/vm+global+virtual

contains a url to add "xvm" label to the current filter and the url for such a filter is:

http://wikis.sun.com/label/vm+global+virtual+xvm

If I go to that url I can remove the "vm" label from the filter by going to:

http://wikis.sun.com/label/global+virtual+xvm

From where I can add the "vm" label back to the filter via:

http://wikis.sun.com/label/global+virtual+xvm+vm

By doing this I got to the same vie via two different urls:
http://wikis.sun.com/label/global+virtual+xvm+vm
http://wikis.sun.com/label/vm+global+virtual+xvm

This usually isn't an issue for users, but when a search crawler hits the sites it always gets caught in indexing the same pages over and over just because the urls are different. This results in poor search index quality as well as unnecessary load on the server.

Proposed solution: sort labels in the URI so that any combination of labels results in only one URI.
fields.summary: Multiple-label filter generates redundant URLs

fields.description:
When an LDAP user whose name in LDAP is in uppercase views their preferences, only 'View Profile' tab is visible.
'Edit Profile', 'Labels', 'Watches' and 'Drafts' are missing, as well as CreatePersonalSpace link. 

This used to work in 2.7.1. 

The reason these tabs don't work is because isViewingMyProfile returns false, when it should be returning true. 

Adding extra debug shows that fails because it is comparing different cases of the same username e.g. 

ADMIN == admin returns false.
fields.summary: users with ldap usernames that are UPPERCASE fail isViewingMyProfile() thus edit tabs and createPersonalSpace links do not work when viewing your perferences

fields.description:
The Calendar plugin is one of Confluence's most popular plugins.

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 10/11/2010|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi All,
Thank you for your patience with this plugin. We are currently looking Calendaring in Confluence and have been researching possible solutions for improving the Calendaring experience in the product. 

If you are interested in participating in some customer feedback, surveys or early access to some prototypes for Calendering please email me (smansour at atlassian dot com) so I can add you to our feedback list. Alternatively, continue to watch this issue and we will update it as we make further progress.

The existing calendar plugin is known to work in Confluence 3.3/3.4, even though it isn't formally supported. As always, we recommend you test the plugin before using it in a production environment. 

Cheers,
Sherif Mansour
Confluence Product Manager
{panel}
fields.summary: include Calendar plugin as supported plugin
atlassian-user.xml has incorrect Crowd integration instructions

fields.description:
The new feature introduced in 2.8 that provides a tree view for editing a page's location (as opposed to the text box which existed in 2.7) fails miserably with large (thousands of pages) flat spaces.  The size of the query and the time required for Javascript processing causes most browsers (Firefox, IE, Safari) to complain that the script is taking too long to run or is exceeding its resources, and prompts the user to terminate the script.

Steps to Reproduce:

1) Create a space with thousands of pages (at least 1700) in a flat (ie: nonexistant) hierarchy.

2) Navigate to any page in the sapce.

3) Click the "Edit" link to edit the page.

4) Scroll to the "Location" field.

5) Click the "Edit" link to move/reorder the page.

6) Watch your browser grind to a halt and prompt you to terminate the script.

What should have happened:

The macro (I assume it's pagetree?) should first query the number of pages in a space, and if it is sufficiently large (say, over 200 pages), only display a portion of the tree at a time.    Or, better yet, there should be a configurable option to use the older, 2.7 interface of a text box (which worked just fine).

I realize that as a workaround, we could change the Edit page template to eliminate the macro, but that's not a feasible long-term solution, as it means that the macro itself is unusable.    Editing the browser preferences to increase the JavaScript timeout is also not a feasible option for a user base in the thousands.
fields.summary: Tree macro for moving/reordering pages in 2.8 fails with large spaces.

fields.description:

We'll hack around it by just not using the macro, but it is a bit inconsistent.

This issue is the root cause for the issues linked to this.
fields.summary: Styles are lost in html, pdf exports and mail notifications

fields.description:
Resetting the ResettableHiLoIdGenerator now happens in two parts:

* the HiLoIdRepairUpgradeTask determines the lowest possible safe 'hi' value and puts it in the database
* the ResetHiLoAfterImportListener forces the configured ID generators to retrieve the next hi value from the database

Unfortunately there is a gap between the two during which more IDs may be assigned by other upgrade tasks. In Studio's case, the InitApplicationKeysUpgradeTask was being run with stale ID generators, causing really hard-to-track-down duplicate key errors.

The ResetHiLoAfterImportListener was installed to make imports safer in a cluster (previously, the generators were only being reset properly on the same node as the import was performed). My recommended fix would be to create a specific HiLoIdResetEvent event that is thrown by the HiLoIdRepairUpgradeTask specifically for the ResetHiLoAfterImportListener, so that the IDs are all properly reset on all nodes before the restore continues.
fields.summary: Race condition in HiLoIdRepairUpgradeTask and ResetHiLoAfterImportListener can lead to primary key violations in upgrade tasks

fields.description:
LDAP GROUP integration: 
when member dn are of the form "uid=xx,cn=xx,ou=xx,dc=xx,dc=xx", 
confluence search with cn="uid", 
that is confluence consider first dn rdn as cn even if it is not 
note that rfc 2253 states that rdn may be in any order
but this a concern when using mapping with certificate (x.509) dn

To replicate problem just change rdn order in ldap groupOfName/member
fields.summary: LDAP GROUP integration: when member dn are of the form "uid=xx,cn=xx,ou=xx,dc=xx,dc=xx", confluence search with cn="uid", that is confluence consider first dn rdn as cn even if it is not

When we do a print preview or print, the sidebar is shown on the page.  If we export to Word or PDF then only the page content is shown.

We would like the print view to NOT show the navigation side bar.
fields.summary: Print view to behave like export and only show page content

fields.description:
Renaming a page with a CameCase'd title sometimes breaks other CamelCase links. It seem to happen when name of the page that gets renamed is part of another page's name. 

*How to reproduce:*
# Enable CamelCase linking
# Create a master page that contains the content snipped "See CamelCasePage and for further instructions go to CamelCasePageFull"
# Create the two referenced pages with CamelCase titles:
#* Sub-page 1: _CamelCasePage_
#* Sub-page 2: _CamelCasePageFull_  <- note that the page name does contain the exact name of sub-page 1
\\
# Go to sub-page 1 and rename it: _CamelCasePage_ -> _Camel Case Page_
# Result: Not only the link to sub-page1 at the master page gets broken (see CONF-4134), but also the other link at the master page to sub-page 2 gets broken, too. (_CamelCasePageFull_ -> _Camel Case PageFull_)

Alternatively, moving to another space will add additional broken prefixes to the link as per CONF-22894.
fields.summary: Renaming or moving CamelCase pages sometimes breaks CamelCase-links to other pages

fields.description:
RequireResource will does not work properly in preview mode.

In preview mode the body is requested and not the entire page, meaning that there is no opportunity to add the resource (javascript or css) to the outer page.

Or is there?

This means that if the page now has a new macro that requires CSS it will be unformatted.  If it requires JS to work properly then it wont work properly.
fields.summary: Some macros are displayed unstyled and ugly in Preview Mode
AbstractMailNotificationQueueItem uses a transient logger, which will not work in a clustered environment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11980].
  {panel}

The drop down menus (Add, Tools, etc) that have been added in 2.8.1 _do not work properly with [screen readers|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Screen_reader]_. 

It is possible to use dynamic elements on a page so that a [screen reader|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Screen_reader] can see them, and so that a blind user can navigate them, but the way that they have been implemented with this theme is not accessible. 

Specifically, the elements are not read out.

Changing the formatting to the Classic Theme is distinctly different from the formatting in the default that were used in 2.7. 

The CSS definitions for headings is off; the font size is dramatically smaller; the "recently updated" widget doesn't display in as nearly a friendly way.

Ideally this should include accessible coded java script with widget menu.

This means simply following good web development practices, such as:
* ensure content is placed in the DOM in document-semantic order
* use semantically relevant elements (e.g. <a> elements for navigation rather than spans)
* use alt tags, etc
fields.summary: 2.8 menus should be accessible by Screen Reader applications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11979].
  {panel}

When importing a large number of pages from disk using the "Import Pages from Disk" feature, the import begins, but the page eventually times out with an HTTP 503 error.  I can then manually return to the Dashboard, and view the pages in the space in question, and see that the import thread is still running.  It successfully completes, however there is no feedback provided to the user about whether the import was successful or not.

Steps to reproduce:

1) Create a directory with a large number (1765 was our count) of text files, ranging in size from 0.5K to 2K.  

2) Create a new space in Confluence.

3) In the Space Admin page, select "Import Pages from Disk".

4) Specify the directory containing the files.

5) Check the "Trim file extensions" checkbox.

6) Click Import.

7) Wait for the page to time out with HTTP 503.

8) Return the Confluence Dashboard

9) View the space into which you are importing the pages.

10) Verify that some pages have been imported, and that the import is continuing.  In Confluence 2.7, there used to be a total page count at the top of the alphabetic page listing, but that seems to have vanished in 2.8

What should have happened:

Confluence should provide some feedback to the user indicating either that the import will continue in the background, or perhaps block until the import is complete.  Ideally, Confluence would use DHTML or server-side push to continuously update the Import page with the progress of the import.
fields.summary: Import Pages From Disk doesn't provide progress updates for large numbers of files

fields.description:
Hi, is it possible to add the ability to use characters (+,&, etc.) in page names, without it messing up the URL?

For example, a page called: C++ generates this URL: http://www.gigaspaces.com/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=31228377

This is important for us, since in the example above we need to call the page something like CPP, which isn't very descriptive to users (it's part of our documentation), or live with a very bad-looking URL.
fields.summary: Problem with including characters in wiki page names

fields.description: When the user [customising the Left Navigation Theme|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Customising+the+Left+Navigation+Theme] in their personal space, there will be a text *"test"* shown beside his personal icon when in the *Preferences* mode.
fields.summary: Customised Left Navigation Theme displays "test" next to user icon.

fields.description:
-- 1 -- 
When using the "View Profile" feature an URL containing ~ character is generated (ex: http://ServerForWiki/wikiservice/display/~user1)
-- 2 --
When you export as PDF a page 
or 
when you use the "Browse Space" then the "Advanced" then the "Export Space" then "Export" button ......... then the "download here" feature.
an URL containing // character is generated (ex:
http://ServerForWiki/wikiservice/download//var/tmp/j2ee/H310/H311/export_05232008_140538/FTWVAL-688130-20080523-14_05_38.pdf
or 
http://ServerForWiki/wikiservice/download//var/tmp/j2ee/H310/H311/export_05232008_140945/FTWVAL-20080523-14_09_53.zip)

As our Our system must be integrated with Siteminder for users authentication in order to ensure company wide SSO and as the rules applied on Siteminder is to drop URL containing ~ and // characters as it is recommended by the  "RFC 3986" norm, these features can't be used by our Users.
This is a PRODUCTION Blocking issue.
fields.summary: Some Confluence URLs contain ~ or // characters that may be blocked by Siteminder security policy

fields.description:
See screenshot.  There seem to be some errors.

Haven't tested 2.9 to see if this is an issue
fields.summary: Startup screen is not decorated

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11974].
  {panel}

Search for "guidelines logger"
http://extranet.atlassian.com/dosearchsite.action?queryString=guidelines+logger&spaceKey=CONFDEV&type=all

Doesn't bring back a comment mentioning "logger" on a page called "logging guidelines".
http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Logging+Guidelines?focusedCommentId=642220725#comment-642220725

A) I would have thought Logging and Logger would have stemmed to the same thing and retrieved the Logging Guidelines page
B) I would have thought at least the *title* of a page would be indexed with a comment.

Point A has been raised separately as CONF-11973.
Point B is the subject of this improvement request.
fields.summary: Indexed comments should include a title field that is the title of the page they are attached to

fields.description:
This probably also affects versions older than 2.8 as well but I've only confirmed it on 2.8 and 2.9.

A search for 'logger' does not find content which contains the term 'logging'.
A quick look at the Porter Stemmer makes it look like these two terms should have a common stem so should actually match.
fields.summary: Terms "Logging" and "Logger" don't reduce to the same stem during search

fields.description:
Intermittently seen on Extranet, this has been confirmed to be a bug with the mail queue on all clustered installations.

The queue implementation uses a clustered cache as its storage mechanism, however the cache is not configured correctly. The configuration is just a normal cache, with a one-hour expiry and maximum of 1000 items.

In some situations (mail server outage, very high volume of email), losing an email from this buffer prevents the buffer from sending any subsequent emails.
fields.summary: Clustered installation stops sending notification emails

fields.description:
someone has probably already reported this but the top twixie on the atlassian extranet is not working properly (see screenshot) - the image preview display doesn't bump down the following content.

:)
fields.summary: Top Twixie not working in dashboard
